alert.note: Alert for Bayamon; Carolina; Catano; Dorado; Guaynabo; Loiza; San Juan; Toa Alta; Toa Baja; Trujillo Alto (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 19 at 2:24AM ADT until September 19 at 7:30AM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Juan has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Bayamon County in Puerto Rico... Carolina County in Puerto Rico... Catano County in Puerto Rico... Dorado County in Puerto Rico... Guaynabo County in Puerto Rico... Loiza County in Puerto Rico... San Juan County in Puerto Rico... Toa Alta County in Puerto Rico... Toa Baja County in Puerto Rico... Trujillo Alto County in Puerto Rico... * Until 630 AM AST. * At 124 AM AST, gauge reports indicated heavy rain falling across the warned area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen since early Sunday morning. The expected rainfall rate is 0.25 to 1 per hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of mainstem rivers including the Rio Piedras, Quebrada Margarita, Quebrada Grande Rio La Plata and Rio Grande de Loiza as well as creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * The following roads were flooded in Bo. Obrero: Avenida Kennedy, Avenida Barbosa, Avenida Munoz Rivera, Roosevelt Ave., Simon Madera de Diego, and Calle Notre Dame in University Gardens. At this time the Rio Piedras was rising rapidly. Due to rains upstream all the mentioned rivers have gone into flood. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Bayamon; Carolina; Catano; Dorado; Guaynabo; Loiza; San Juan; Toa Alta; Toa Baja; Trujillo Alto
